title: Hill Dwarf
data:
***Obsolete**: This article refers to an aspect of the game which has been removed. It is retained for historical reference only.*

**Hill dwarves** are extremely robust but poor at using magic. They are excellent at melee combat, especially with [axes](/Axes "Axes") or [bludgeoning weapons](/Maces_%26_Flails "Maces & Flails"), and are good at using [armour](/Armour "Armour") and [shields](/Shields "Shields"), but are poor at missile combat or at using [polearms](/Polearms "Polearms") (which are usually too big for them to wield comfortably). The only forms of magic which they can use with even a minimal degree of aptitude are [earth](/Earth_Magic "Earth Magic"), [fire](/Fire_Magic "Fire Magic"), and [conjurations](/Conjuration "Conjuration"). They advance in levels at a similar rate to [common elves](/Elf "Elf").

## Contents

- [1 Available Classes](#Available_Classes)
- [2 Level Bonuses](#Level_Bonuses)
- [3 Skill aptitudes](#Skill_aptitudes)
- [4 History](#History)

## Available Classes

Hill dwarves can be [Fighters](/Fighter "Fighter"), [Priests](/Priest "Priest"), [Thieves](/Thief "Thief"), [Gladiators](/Gladiator "Gladiator"), [Berserkers](/Berserker "Berserker"), [Hunters](/Hunter "Hunter"), [Conjurers](/Conjurer "Conjurer"), [Enchanters](/Enchanter "Enchanter"), [Fire Elementalists](/Fire_Elementalist "Fire Elementalist"), [Earth Elementalists](/Earth_Elementalist "Earth Elementalist") and [Healers](/Healer "Healer").

## Level Bonuses

- +1 [HP](/HP "HP") every 2 out of 3 levels.
- -1 [MP](/MP "MP") every 2 levels.
- +1 [strength](/Strength "Strength") every 4th level.

## Skill aptitudes

The lower the value, the better the aptitude.

## History

- Hill dwarves were removed in [0.3](/0.3 "0.3"), due to their similarity to [mountain dwarves](/Mountain_dwarves "Mountain dwarves"). Their aptitudes were nearly identical, never more than ±20 in the old aptitude system (equivalent to ±1 aptitude today). MD were slightly better at magic, and HD slightly better at melee. When HD were removed, some of MD's aptitudes (notably Axes and M\&F) were changed to compensate.

* One notable difference between the species was that, back when "non-recommended" race/class combos were actually forbidden, HD could be [berserkers](/Berserker "Berserker") while MD could not.
